thanks for your answers!

A few people here refer to maven as their library=
 management tool. So
far I thought of maven as a extension to ant. Could so=
mebody give me a
hint how JUnit is installed with maven?

ben



--- In jun=
it@yahoogroups.com, B=F6hm, Martin <martin.boehm@...> wrote:
>
> Hi,
> 
> I=
'm using JUnit on windows systems. The several
> Java-RTs und SDKs I usuall=
y install on
> 
> %program files%\java
> 	\j2rt1.4
> 	\j2se1.4.2
> 	\jdk1.5=

> 	\jdk1.6
> 	\j2me
> 
> For the default java runtime I use 1.6 and set it=

> to JAVA_HOME=3D%program files%\java\jdk1.6
> 
> For libraries I usually =
use maven. So its very
> simple to set references to any library. I set it
=
> to PATH=3D%PATH%,C:\mvnrepos
> 
> In special cases I also use a separate =
lib
> directory. Its a remainder of the time before I
> used Maven. But its=
 rather obsolete if you have
> access to a global maven repository.
> 
> Ru=
nning the tests I also use Maven, so calling
> "mvn test" runs all my tests=
 and on the other hand
> using patterns like "mvn test Dtest=3D*ServiceTest=
"
> runs only the service tests as well.
> 
> Nevertheless I set the maven =
install directory
> to the PATH variable to call it quickly from
> any proj=
ect location.
> 
> Sounds like a promotion for maven, but it really
> simpl=
ifies my tasks.
> 
> Regards,
> Martin
>

> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On

t environment. It

ng the jdk.zip file from SUN, where do you put

: C:\jse5, (others ?)

(do the mac

t path?)

> > -------------=
---------------

> > 
> > WIN: ?
> > M=
AC: /Developer/Java, ~/Library/Java/, ... ?

ent Settings for JUnit in .bash_profile
> > -------------------------------=
-------------------

>=
 > export JUNIT_HOME=3D"/Developer/jlibs/junit"
> > PATH=3D$PATH:$JYTHON_HO=
ME:$JUNIT_HOME

.jar:$JUNIT_HOME

>=
 > and

g junit

to run junit then with commands like

tCore ...

 lot for your answers
